alert.note: Alert for Concho; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 11:54PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Coleman, northern McCulloch, north central Menard and Concho Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 765, or near Millersview, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paint Rock, Eden, Melvin, Gouldbusk, Lohn, Rockwood, Voss, Waldrip, Leaday, Eola, Pear Valley, Doole, Ivie Reservoir Near Concho Park Marina, Stacy, Salt Gap, Millersview, Live Oak, Fife, Mozelle and Us- 83 Near The Menard-Concho County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
